questions.text: Regarding Lung abscess all are true except :

questions.text: A 68-year-old female presents for evaluation of SOB without wheezing or cough. She is being treated for SLE and her PFT results are given below. Most probable abnormality is:

A 52-year-old female presents with a community acquired pneumonia complicated by pleural effusion. A thoracentesis is performed, with the following results: pH 7.11 Protein 5.8 g/dL LDH 285 IU/L Glucose 66 mg/dL WBC 3800/mm3 RBC 24,000/mm3 PMNs 93% Gram stain Many PMNs; no organism seen Bacterial cultures are sent, but the results are not currently available. options.label: D
options.text: Lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) more than two-thirds of the normal upper limit for serum

questions.text: A 68-year-old male is admitted to the emergency room complaining about shortness of breath, fever, chills and cough with purulent sputum production for the last 2 days. He is a nonsmoker without any previous medical history. The patient looks tired but other than that he is in good condition without any confusion. Vital signs are blood pressure 105/70 mmHg, heart rate 110 beats per min, breathing rate 32 breaths per min, and temperature 38.9 °C. Bronchial breath sounds are heard on auscultation of the right chest. Blood tests reveal a white blood cell count of 9000 × 109 per L with a left shift haematocrit 46%, urea 35g%, creatinine 1.6 mg% sodium 142 mmol/l and oxygen saturation (room air) 92%. A chest radiograph demonstrates moderate cardiomegaly and a right lower lobe infltrate with air bronchograms. Which one of the following is the appropriate management decision for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Treat as an outpatient, start empirical antibiotic therapy without further examinations

options.label: B
options.text: Reat as an outpatient, take blood and sputum cultures, start empirical antibiotic therapy

options.label: C
options.text: Admit to hospital, start empirical antibiotic therapy within 4 h of admission

options.label: D
options.text: Admit to ICU, take blood and sputum cultures and Gram stains, start antibiotic therapy according to results.

questions.correct_answer: C. Admit to hospital, start empirical antibiotic therapy within 4 h of admission

questions.text: Regarding the Berlin definition for acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) true all except :

questions.text: Which of the following is true about cushing syndrome :-

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. Serum potassium level <3.3 mmol/L is suggestive of ectopic ACTH production

questions.text: About cushing syndrome,true is:-

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: CA of adrenal is more common than adenoma.

options.text: Increased ACTH secretion is the commonest cause.

questions.correct_answer: D. Increased ACTH secretion is the commonest cause.

questions.text: Lalloo,50 year old ,a chronic smoker,presents wih history of hemoptysis.He was having truncal obesity and hypertension.He had elevated ACTH level which was not suppressible with high dose of dexamethasone.What would be most probable diagnosis:-

Which of the following is a correct statement regarding the management of pituitary apoplexy ?

options.label: A
options.text: Daily formal assessment of visual field and acuity is indicated in patients with reduced/defective visual fields.

options.label: B
options.text: Steroid therapy is indicated in all patients.

options.label: C
options.text: Surgical management is indicated in all patients irrespective of severity of visual field defects.

options.label: D
options.text: Urgent neurosurgical intervention is indicated in all patients with or without significant decline in level of consciousness.

questions.correct_answer: A. Daily formal assessment of visual field and acuity is indicated in patients with reduced/defective visual fields.

questions.text: A patient has neurosurgery for a pituitary tumor that requires resection of gland.Which of the following functions of adrenal gland will be preserved in this patient immediately postoperatively ?

options.label: A
options.text: Morning peak of plasma cortisol level.

options.label: C
options.text: Sodium retention in response to hypovolemia.

questions.correct_answer: C. Sodium retention in response to hypovolemia.

questions.text: A 45 year old female with headache is diagnosed with empty sella on MRI with no other radiological finding.What should be next step in her management :-

options.label: A
options.text: Diagnose her with subclinical panhypopitutarism and initiate low dose hormone replacement therapy.

options.label: B
options.text: Reassure her and follow laboratory results closely.

options.label: C
options.text: Reassure her and repeat MRI in 6 months.

options.label: D
options.text: This may represent early endocrine malignancy –whole body positron emission tomography is indicated.

questions.correct_answer: B. Reassure her and follow laboratory results closely.
